theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage to mitochondrial components leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related increase in mitochondrial ROS (H2O2) production and self-amplifying oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS as causal agents damaging mitochondrial complex I and cardiolipin, driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial oxidative stress and increased ROS emission to aging and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA deletions accumulation due to oxidative damage and replication errors causing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation and clonal expansion of mtDNA mutations impairing mitochondrial function and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights somatic mtDNA mutations causing premature aging phenotypes in mutator mice.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of specific mtDNA deletions in aging tissues causing mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mtDNA damage to bioenergetic crisis and apoptosis driving tissue degeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Correlates mtDNA rearrangements accumulation with bioenergetic decline in aging skeletal muscle.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes inherited and somatic mtDNA mutations impairing mitochondrial function and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and Deletion Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General mitochondrial dysfunction caused by somatic mtDNA mutations leading to aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative damage accumulation to mtDNA, proteins, and lipids causing mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Mitophagy Impairment Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on impaired mitophagy leading to accumulation of dysfunctional mitochondria and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Mitophagy Impairment Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial quality control via mitophagy, dynamics, and autophagy in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Mitophagy Impairment Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dynamics, mitophagy, and biogenesis maintaining mitochondrial homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Mitophagy Impairment Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details actin-mediated mitochondrial quality control via retrograde actin cable flow in yeast aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Mitophagy Impairment Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes region-specific mitochondrial anchorage maintaining quality and lifespan in yeast mother cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Quality Control and Mitophagy Impairment Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on asymmetric segregation of damaged mitochondria during yeast cell division for quality control.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Permeability Transition and Apoptosis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mPTP sensitization causing apoptosis and muscle deterioration with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Permeability Transition and Apoptosis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in mitochondrial membrane potential linked to PTPC alterations and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Permeability Transition and Apoptosis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial bioenergetic decline and redox signaling to aging and mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Quality Control Dysregulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on Lon protease dysregulation impairing mitochondrial protein quality control during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dynamics and Programmed Cell Death Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial fusion/fission balance and fragmentation driving aging and cell death.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Coenzyme Q Biosynthesis Deficiency and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes clk-1 mutation impairing coenzyme Q biosynthesis affecting mitochondrial function and lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Control Region Somatic Mutation Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes somatic mtDNA control region mutations remodel replication to maintain mitochondrial function in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Proteostasis Protection via Stress-Specific HSF-1 Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial stress-specific HSF-1 remodeling proteostasis to protect against age-related collapse.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Hormesis and Mitokine-Mediated Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mild mitochondrial stress inducing mitokines that promote longevity via hormesis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutation effects on ROS dynamics, mitochondrial morphology, and accelerated aging.
